intro: Eganthus, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to blue or purple. Eganthus species are often found growing in rocky soils or along riverbanks. These plants are valued for their ornamental beauty and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their unique floral display.
